```{r , echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
# Libraries

library(tidyverse)
library(readr)
library(kableExtra)
library(bookdown)
library(lubridate)

```



\section*{Country XX1 and YY1"}

```{r read-data}
corona <- read_csv('Data/worldwidecases.csv')
```

```{r covid-table}
corona %>% 
  filter(year == 2020,
         countriesAndTerritories %in% c('Jordan', 'Saudi_Arabia')) %>% 
  group_by(countriesAndTerritories, month) %>%
  summarise(cases = sum(cases)) %>% 
  kable(caption = 'Jordan and Saudi cases per month in 2020')
  
```

As per \@ref(tab:covid-table)), Saudi Arabia had more cases in each month.

```{r covid-figure}
corona %>% 
  filter(countriesAndTerritories %in% c('Jordan', 'Saudi_Arabia')) %>% 
  mutate(dateRep = dmy(dateRep)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = dateRep, y= deaths, color = countriesAndTerritories)) +
  geom_line()


```

As can be seen from \@ref(fig:covid-figure)), Saudi had more deaths over time than Jordan
